commit_message:
hyper-v: Logs tips on PortBindingFailed

When spawning an Hyper-V instance with NICs having the vif_type "hyperv",
neutron will fail to bind the port to the Hyper-V host if the neutron
server doesn't have the "hyperv" mechanism driver installed and configured,
resulting in a PortBindingFailed exception on the nova-compute side.

When this exception is encountered, the logs will say to check the
neutron-server logs, but the problem and its solution are not obvious
or clear, resulting in plenty of questions / reports, all having the
same solution: is there an L2 agent on the host alive and reporting to
neutron, and if neutron Hyper-V agent is used, make sure to install
networking-hyperv and configure neutron-server to use the "hyperv"
mechanism_driver.

(cherry-picked from commit d4fa1d7da15a1c9c69a81365e34c8d94ebd070a2)

Change-Id: I94ed8f15f3c6312a6f675b9255aff7e9d76f96fc
Closes-Bug: #1744032

commit_message:
Improve WMI jobs logging

This change provides additional log information when handling WMI
jobs. This allows us to get a better picture of the job states.

This will be extremely helpful for debugging purposes, as currently
we don't get much information about pending jobs or errors that
occur when stopping jobs.

(cherry-picked from commit 58509209b963dd14a217bbfa5b81b1583980c881)

Closes-Bug: #1748208

Change-Id: Ibb4d5969eea13a0b11a6d5b46b797482a6d2a20b

Exception: %s. commit_message:
Fix bindep platform declaration

Bindep takes a list of platform identifiers and profile names.
Each platform needs to be prepended with "platform:" to mark
it as such, with any other stand alone word being interpreted
as a profile name.

This fixes and error where we tried listing multiple platforms
in one tag.

Change-Id: I2bdd8e8312f3eb556b6a4277794d3c5d25008a12

commit_message:
Resolve get_dns_view error after selecting multi-tenant view

Adds a second comparison check when deciding whether to display the single
tenant view or multi-tenant view in Infoblox. The issue is that the DB field
is set to '0', which is not interpreted as false.

Change-Id: Id0fac71cc6d82123a7ee5d5983467acd1b8e5a9e
Closes-Bug: 1752349
(cherry picked from commit e4de365775c1f6f2722f2ad3109f3349d9a5a691)

commit_message:
Docs: Elaborate on feature flag in HACKING file

This is to elaborate on feature flag functionality in Tempest's
HACKING.rst. Currently, there isn't much documentation on feature
flags in Tempest or how to add them. The only place feature
flag is mentioned is in this file. Since testtools.skip(Unless|If)
is a common way of using a feature flag, it is mentioned. Also,
Tempest's interaction with DevStack is an important thing to mention
when explaining how to introduce a new feature flag.

Change-Id: Ia47132fa596918e58f21ba9810c2c28ddcf0d584
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/03/556703/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: projects the new test has to be properly skipped with a feature flag. This can be just as simple as using the ``@utils.requires_ext()`` or ``testtools.skipUnless`` decorators to check if the required extension (or discoverable optional API) or feature is enabled or can be as difficult asmechanism to disable the test with older stable releases and the new test won't be able to merge. Introduction of a new feature flag requires specifying a default value for the corresponding config option that is appropriate in the latest OpenStack release. Because Tempest is branchless, the feature flag's default value will need to be overridden to a value that is appropriate in earlier releases in which the feature isn't available. In DevStack, this can be accomplished by modifying Tempest's lib installation script for previous branches (because DevStack is branched).

subject: Update parameter names in microversion sdk spec
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-29 16:46:29.000000000', 'files': ['guidelines/sdk-exposing-microversions.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/api-sig/commit/38bdf4eff01ac54f44ff972e0dd9ea17dd40b996', 'message': 'Update parameter names in microversion sdk spec

keystoneauth/openstacksdk already basically support what the spec calls
for (other than a list of default microversions) However, they use
different option names than what here.

Although the examples are examples, it's quite likley people
implementing things will follow the naming.

Because of version discovery, the words "api_version", "min_version" and
"max_version" all carry meaning referring to finding major versions.
(For instance, shade supports v2 and v3 of cinder, and so creates the
keystoneauth1.adapter.Adapter instance with min_version=2, max_version=3
and keystoneauth gets the latest available major version endpoint)

So that things aren't confusing, the parameter names "microversion" and
"default_microversion" were chosen. microversion is given on a per-call
basis. default_microversion is given to a constructor.

Update the examples to use terms that match keystoneauth/openstacksdk.

Change-Id: If10f552477c97a9fd234423c673cab86be3f2981
'}]
commit_message:
Update parameter names in microversion sdk spec

keystoneauth/openstacksdk already basically support what the spec calls
for (other than a list of default microversions) However, they use
different option names than what here.

Although the examples are examples, it's quite likley people
implementing things will follow the naming.

Because of version discovery, the words "api_version", "min_version" and
"max_version" all carry meaning referring to finding major versions.
(For instance, shade supports v2 and v3 of cinder, and so creates the
keystoneauth1.adapter.Adapter instance with min_version=2, max_version=3
and keystoneauth gets the latest available major version endpoint)

So that things aren't confusing, the parameter names "microversion" and
"default_microversion" were chosen. microversion is given on a per-call
basis. default_microversion is given to a constructor.

Update the examples to use terms that match keystoneauth/openstacksdk.

Change-Id: If10f552477c97a9fd234423c673cab86be3f2981

commit_message:
Ensures that all classes have the same interface as their parents

VMUtils10 has a few extra methods when compared to VMUtils. This
patch adds those methods to VMUtils (raising NotImplementedError).

Adds unit test that checks for future inconsistentcies.

ISCSIInitiatorCLIUtils has been deprecated and removed, but it was
not removed from utilsfactory.utils_map. This patch addresses this
issue.

(cherry-picked from commit ea65d0a5105d0a1e258cd26f653fef91b6336746)

Closes-Bug: #1746986

Change-Id: I2a963304fc67595bc18e719e6b4420f553519c41

The argument `--tasks` of `rally task report` is deprecated from Rally 0.10.
Unfortunately, the wrong destination was used, so `--tasks` argument stopped

This patch fixes destination for `--tasks` argument. As well, this patch

commit_message:
Fix 'rally task report --tasks'

The argument `--tasks` of `rally task report` is deprecated from Rally 0.10.
Unfortunately, the wrong destination was used, so `--tasks` argument stopped
working.

This patch fixes destination for `--tasks` argument. As well, this patch
improves the deprecation warning message to include an alternative
argument if presents (currently alternative argument is displayed only
in help message).

Change-Id: I45750027ddc1f39fc362b1d776f847707c8e7d67
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/91/558491/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Defaults to parent_resource name correctly

When name attribute of deployment is an empty
string, dict.get will return that empty string
instead of returning the default value set in
the second param of dict.get(first, second).
This patch fixes it by returning the default
value.

Change-Id: I7b48414fd18e01594f6d9b0d106c2abb71b7f676
Related-Bug: #1755078

subject: Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning
revisions:

LOG.warn is deprecated in Python 3 [1] . But it still used in a few places, non-deprecated LOG.warning should be used instead.

Note: If we are using logger from oslo.log, warn is still valid [2], but I agree we can switch to LOG.warning.

[1]https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
[2]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.log/blob/master/oslo_log/log.py#L85

commit_message:
Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated in Python 3 [1] . But it still used in a few places, non-deprecated LOG.warning should be used instead.

Note: If we are using logger from oslo.log, warn is still valid [2], but I agree we can switch to LOG.warning.

[1]https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning
[2]https://github.com/openstack/oslo.log/blob/master/oslo_log/log.py#L85

Change-Id: Ibbcc287815cbc06162a13448c2dabcb0748e4e32
Closes-Bug: #1508442

commit_message:
Cache barbican certs for periodic tasks

Added configuration parameter, temp_cache_dir, to magnum.conf with
default value of "/var/lib/magnum/certificate-cache". This local
directory will hold cached cluster TLS credentials that are generated
during periodic tasks, to reduce load as the number of clusters
increases. If the temp_cache_dir does not exist, the certificates
will be created as tempfiles.

Closes-Bug: #1659545

Change-Id: I8808c4098a7c8d22dbfc841142c9f9c8b976dde1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/64/534364/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import magnum.conf import os import shutil CONF = magnum.conf.CONF def _create_cached_cert_files(self): self.cached_key_file = '%s/client.key' % self.cached_cert_dir self.cached_cert_file = '%s/client.crt' % self.cached_cert_dir self.cached_ca_file = '%s/ca.crt' % self.cached_cert_dir os.path.mkdir(self.cached_cert_dir) shutil.copy(self.key_file, self.cached_key_file) shutil.copy(self.cert_file, self.cached_cert_file) shutil.copy(self.ca_file, self.cached_ca_file) def _set_config(self, cluster, ca, cert, key): config = k8s_config.Configuration() config.host = cluster.api_address config.ssl_ca_cert = ca.name config.cert_file = cert.name config.key_file = key.name return config self.cached_cert_dir = os.path.join(CONF.drivers.temp_cache_dir, cluster.uuid) if not os.path.exists(self.cached_cert_dir): if cluster.magnum_cert_ref: (self.ca_file, self.key_file, self.cert_file) = create_client_files(cluster, context) self._create_cached_cert_files() configs = self._set_config(cluster, self.ca_file, self.cert_file, self.key_file) else: configs = self._set_config(cluster, self.cached_ca_file, self.cached_cert_file, self.cached_key_file) client = api_client.ApiClient(configuration=configs)
deleted_lines: if cluster.magnum_cert_ref: (self.ca_file, self.key_file, self.cert_file) = create_client_files(cluster, context) config = k8s_config.Configuration() config.host = cluster.api_address config.ssl_ca_cert = self.ca_file.name config.cert_file = self.cert_file.name config.key_file = self.key_file.name client = api_client.ApiClient(configuration=config)

subject: Ensure that RDO/SUSE series repo instructions stay up to date
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-04 10:35:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/9c0c607a84b9659dea447fcf0149c9817e4cf5c5', 'message': "Ensure that RDO/SUSE series repo instructions stay up to date

The deployment host documentation gets out of date really quickly.
This patch makes it self maintaining. Note that due to the fact
that RDO/SUSE do not implement their repositories for a new
release until much, much later in the cycle, we use the previous
release repo for master. This will self-update during our RC
when the stable branch is cut.

Some formatting adjustments have made to prevent the interpretation

commit_message:
Ensure that RDO/SUSE series repo instructions stay up to date

The deployment host documentation gets out of date really quickly.
This patch makes it self maintaining.

Note that due to the fact that this is a stable branch and that
the documentation configuration is vastly different to master,
this is a re-implementation rather than a backport.

Some formatting adjustments have made to prevent the interpretation
of URL's as links by sphinx and to remove the use of multi-line shell
commands.

Closes-Bug: #1759721
Change-Id: Id28540d335390a52e0eb65a734a1d594235265d6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/77/558777/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: rdo_series = previous_series_name suse_series = previous_series_name.capitalize() rdo_series = current_series_name suse_series = current_series_name.capitalize().. |rdo_series| replace:: %s .. |suse_series| replace:: %s latest_tag, rdo_series, suse_series)

be used by Gnocchi scenarios in further patches.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/453861/

commit_message:
Use UDID on vscsi mappings

We have been passing udid to _add_append_mapping for iscsi but not
for vscsi. We know the udid for vscsi as well, so it's easy to pass
it. This may help resolve name conflicts or may have no effect, but
should not hurt.

Change-Id: I7a3c0576208dde3e32ecc7b27def2e2e7c401560
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/32/558832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Specify defaults for pip_install_upper_constraints

If this role is run without having pip_install_upper_constraints set
then you'll get a failure stating that pip_install_upper_constraints is
undefined.

This patch simply adds the default filter when referencing
pip_install_upper_constraints, which seems to be the pattern used in
openstack-ansible's utility-install.yml playbook.

Change-Id: If1b68fb21e0eb8f2f8c33a6bec952c2972e3e5e3
(cherry picked from commit 5a99262155f8b6766ec893fc57854a5b2198f495)

commit_message:
Save logs from alternative oslo.messaging backend servers

oslo.messaging has the option of supporting non-rabbitmq backends,
like qpidd, dispatch-router, or kafka (in development). If any of
these backend's log files are present save them when cleaning up the
host.

Change-Id: I9c76058942cc6cb22480621e69e8be2e0763a8af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate refs/changes/48/523948/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # save any alternative oslo.messaging backend log files save_file $BASE/new/qpidd.log save_file $BASE/new/qdrouterd.log save_file $BASE/amqp1

added_lines: # NOTE(rosmaita): have to explicitly set to None the declared but unused # arguments (the configparser does that for us normally) base_args = {'name': 'Mortimer', 'disk_format': 'raw', 'container_format': 'bare', 'progress': False, 'file': None, 'uri': None, 'import_method': None} import_info_response = {'import-methods': { 'type': 'array', 'description': 'Import methods available.', 'value': ['glance-direct', 'web-download']}} def _mock_utils_exit(self, msg): import sys sys.exit(msg) @mock.patch('glanceclient.common.utils.print_image') @mock.patch('glanceclient.v2.shell.do_image_import') @mock.patch('glanceclient.v2.shell.do_image_stage') @mock.patch('glanceclient.common.utils.exit') @mock.patch('os.access') @mock.patch('sys.stdin', autospec=True) def test_neg_image_create_via_import_web_download_with_file( self, mock_stdin, mock_access, mock_utils_exit, mk_stage, mk_import, mk_print_image): expected_msg = ('who cares') my_args = self.base_args.copy() my_args['import_method'] = 'web-download' my_args['uri'] = 'https://example.org/some/stuff' my_args['file'] = 'some.file' args = self._make_args(my_args) mock_stdin.isatty = lambda: True mock_access.return_value = True mock_utils_exit.side_effect = self._mock_utils_exit # this will be true because we're including a valid file (same # deal if we were passing data over stdin) self.mock_get_data_file.return_value = True with mock.patch.object(self.gc.images, 'get_import_info') as mocked_info: with mock.patch.object(self.gc.images, 'create') as mocked_create: with mock.patch.object(self.gc.images, 'get') as mocked_get: mocked_info.return_value = self.import_info_response mocked_get.return_value = {"id": "1234"} mocked_create.return_value = {"id": "1234"} test_shell.do_image_create_via_import(self.gc, args) # would like exit to be called, but isn't mock_utils_exit.assert_not_called() # not sure if we should create an image in this case, but we do mocked_create.assert_called_once() # don't want data staged in this case, but it is mk_stage.assert_called_once() # what's going to happen is that this call will return OK, but # the task will fail and the image will be stuck in 'importing' mk_import.assert_called_once()

commit_message:
Fix publishing infra/publications

The two publishing jobs failed, fix them:
* ZUUL_REFNAME in playbooks/publications/run.yaml#n12 is not set, use
  the proper variable.
* index publishing is done from master, always check out master for
  this like it was done for version 2.

Change-Id: I494c69e51282418bbc7cac45454abe8c52e6920f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/27/558727/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Index is always published from master override-branch: master

commit_message:
[rally] Remove several redundant jobs

Rally team moved all OpenStack plugins under separate repository
(openstack/rally-openstack) which has new jobs based on Zuul V3
workflow.

Despite the fact we still want to check deprecated in-tree plugins in
rally repo, we do not need to launch the whole list of them. Let's
decrease cost of CI for Rally project.

Needed-By: Id6bf198cbc8eaa44f682a6465cf6d43809b7fd98

Change-Id: I9f44ebf9ab569a94c5c8690ec3283f9d944fd3fc

commit_message:
Monkey-patch etcd3gw's Watcher to avoid socket leak

Try to duplicate the socket and call shutdown() to forcibly
close the connection.

Change-Id: Ie5c1d286180d0bdb3d38c8e550879c3d36f2c93f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/64/558564/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import socket import etcd3gw.watch as watchclass ForceClosingWatcher(watch.Watcher): def stop(self): try: # Workaround for (at least) Python 2.7.12. Shut down the socket to # force close both legs of the connection. Without this, the socket # sticks waiting for some data to read. # # We make our own socket from the file handle so that we disturb the # real socket as little as possible. From the real socket's point of # view, the socket will appear to fail. s = socket.fromfd(self._response.raw._fp.fileno(), socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM) s.shutdown(socket.SHUT_RDWR) s.close() except Exception as e: LOG.warning("Failed to force-close etcd3gw's watch socket: %r", e) # Defer to the superclass to do the rest of its cleanup. super(ForceClosingWatcher, self).stop() watch.Watcher = ForceClosingWatcher

commit_message:
Use constraints with get-pip.py

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/558124
- https://review.openstack.org/558599

Presently no constraints are passed to get-pip.py when installing
pip, so we just receive the latest version of pip/setuptools/wheel
everywhere without respecting global-requirement-pins or any other
constraints.

To avoid this we'll pass pip_install_upper_constraints args to
get-pip.py by default.

Change-Id: I32603fd34b60183607c6bd9653c36432cbe6b07a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_install refs/changes/11/558811/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: python /opt/get-pip.py {{ (pip_install_upper_constraints is defined) | ternary('--constraint ' ~ pip_install_upper_constraints | default(''), '') }} {{ pip_source_install_options }} python /opt/get-pip.py --isolated {{ (pip_install_upper_constraints is defined) | ternary('--constraint ' ~ pip_install_upper_constraints | default(''), '') }} {{ pip_source_install_options }} {{ pip_get_pip_options }} {{ pip_packages | map('quote') | join (' ') }}
deleted_lines: python /opt/get-pip.py {{ pip_source_install_options }} python /opt/get-pip.py --isolated {{ pip_source_install_options }} {{ pip_get_pip_options }} {{ pip_packages | map('quote') | join (' ') }}

commit_message:
Update to openstack-tox-linters job

tripleo-ipsec is a project with ansible roles, also we want to follow
the same job pattern as other projects do [1], so we want to run
openstack-tox-linters to ensure a good ansible code quality.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/commit/fb5208f53c10ff617b637552d5645a78d0b03954

Change-Id: I12202944da10cacbb9a23dd73169addb086cde29

commit_message:
Specify defaults for pip_install_upper_constraints

If this role is run without having pip_install_upper_constraints set
then you'll get a failure stating that pip_install_upper_constraints is
undefined.

This patch simply adds the default filter when referencing
pip_install_upper_constraints, which seems to be the pattern used in
openstack-ansible's utility-install.yml playbook.

Change-Id: If1b68fb21e0eb8f2f8c33a6bec952c2972e3e5e3
(cherry picked from commit 5a99262155f8b6766ec893fc57854a5b2198f495)

commit_message:
Volume detach should have instance uuid

For multiattach volumes we need the instance uuid to be
passed when volume detach api is called to identify the
correct volume to detach.

Change-Id: I810f3ecb2ca02a39532f21c6830ff93e6a84cb1f

commit_message:
WIP: Enabling DIB for RHEL7 PPC64le

Currently DIB does not completely support the rhel7 ppc64le images.
Adding the support for DIB base rhel7 element for ppc64le.

Closes-bug: #bug_1629283

subject: Skip host pip installs for ansible bootstrap
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-09-12 13:20:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/b8b36e2783be41ec2ac3d5c9af422727dab864cf', 'message': 'Try not to pip install into host python system packages

Rather than pip installing into the host system packages,
we try to just ensure that we use packages on the host
to setup the virtualenv, then we pip install only into
the virtualenv.

commit_message:
Skip host pip installs for ansible bootstrap

The requirements.txt contents do not need to be
installed on to the host. The majority of the
requirements are for ansible, or for release
and management tooling which needs to use the
Ansible runtime venv.

Rather than forcing the installation of pip on
the host, we only install virtualenv via distro
packages (where possible). With virtualenv in
place we can create the runtime venv and install
pip, etc and all requirements into there.

Doing this keeps the system python libraries as
clean as possible, preventing clashes with other
packages (eg: ceph) which try to install other
python libraries which conflict on CentOS.

Change-Id: I0db786645c11649764680697518c97ddf9610cfa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/91/502991/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: libselinux-python \ python-virtualenv \ python-crypto python-apt python3-apt \ python-virtualenv \ python-crypto libffi-devel libopenssl-devel python-pip \ python-virtualenv python-crypto# but also make sure that it is at least version 9.x or above # so that it supports the use of the constraint option.# Install virtualenv if it is not already installed, # but also make sure it is at least version 15.x or above # so that it supports using the no-pip, no-setuptools # and no-wheels options. VIRTUALENV_VERSION=$(virtualenv --version 2>/dev/null | cut -d. -f1) if [[ "${VIRTUALENV_VERSION}" -lt "15" ]]; then pip install ${PIP_OPTS} \ --constraint ${UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE} \ virtualenv \ || pip install ${PIP_OPTS} \ --constraint ${UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE} \ --isolated \ virtualenv # Ensure that our shell knows about the new pip hash -r virtualenv fi
deleted_lines: libselinux-python python-apt python3-apt libffi-devel libopenssl-devel python-pip# but also make sure that it is at least version 9.x or above.# Install the requirements for the various python scripts # on to the host, including virtualenv. pip install ${PIP_OPTS} \ --requirement requirements.txt \ --constraint ${UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE} \ || pip install ${PIP_OPTS} \ --requirement requirements.txt \ --constraint ${UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE} \ --isolated

commit_message:
Set new parameter in OVS to support ODL Oxygen

ODL oxygen provides a new framework to configure tunnels called autotunnels.
SFC requires tunnels to be flow-based and to arrange that in the autotunnel
framework, the OVS internal parameter of-tunnel must be set to true.

That parameter is not read in previous ODL versions. Therefore, this patch
does not break backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Iec6a741d1e1081da547fe6fc0a67dd723e714d60
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron refs/changes/33/553333/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Set the of-tunnel to true command: "ovs-vsctl set Open_vSwitch . external_ids:of-tunnel=true" when: - neutron_plugin_base == 'networking_sfc.services.sfc.plugin.SfcPlugin'

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri parameter

Option "auth_uri" from group "keystone_authtoken" is deprecated[1].
Use option "www_authenticate_uri" from group "keystone_authtoken".

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I092efd9c530b3108a88c4f6f364f7b4adbaf6a80
Depends-On: I4c82a63baabd6b9304b302c97cd751a0103d8316
Closes-Bug: #1759098

added_lines: # [*www_authenticate_uri*]# DEPRECATED PARAMETERS # # [*auth_uri*] # (Optional) Complete public Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to undef # $www_authenticate_uri = 'http://localhost:5000', # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $auth_uri = undef, if $auth_uri { warning('The auth_uri parameter is deprecated. Please use www_authenticate_uri instead.') } $www_authenticate_uri_real = pick($auth_uri, $www_authenticate_uri) www_authenticate_uri => $www_authenticate_uri_real,

commit_message:
Update readme.rst

This patch updates Watcher Tempest tests execution section in readme.

* Use stestr instead of testr.
* Use tempest CLI instead of run_tempest.sh which was removed.

Change-Id: If8a38c98d6cf542b861819d7db3fa32beff8b102
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-tempest-plugin refs/changes/51/557551/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ stestr list watcher $ tempest run --config-file watcher-cloud/etc/tempest.conf --regex watcher $ tempest run --regex watcher $ tempest run --config-file watcher-cloud/etc/tempest.conf --regex \ watcher_tempest_plugin.tests.api.admin.test_audit_template.TestCreateDeleteAuditTemplate.test_create_audit_template
deleted_lines: $ testr list-tests watcher $ ./run_tempest.sh --config watcher-cloud/etc/tempest.conf -N -- watcher $ ../run_tempest.sh -N -- watcher $ ./run_tempest.sh --config watcher-cloud/etc/tempest.conf -N \ -- watcher_tempest_plugin.tests.api.admin.test_audit_template.TestCreateDeleteAuditTemplate.test_create_audit_template

commit_message:
Validate scheduling fields in basic ops scenario

Currently there is no validation of node scheduling fields - resource
class and traits - in the scenario tests. This change adds validation of
these fields to the bare metal basic ops test.

We query the flavor used to boot the instance, and extract all requested
resources and traits from extra_specs. These are matched against the
resource class and traits set on the bare metal node that was scheduled.

Change-Id: I9ddc895ead61cf02c6967ead094d061cb7f558d8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/545370
Related-Bug: #1722194
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin refs/changes/97/545297/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Validates Ironic node's resource class and traits have been honoured @staticmethod def _is_version_supported(version): """Return whether an API microversion is supported.""" max_version = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest( CONF.baremetal.max_microversion) version = api_version_request.APIVersionRequest(version) return version <= max_version if self._is_version_supported('1.28'): def validate_scheduling(self): """Validate scheduling attributes of the node against the flavor. Validates the resource class and traits requested by the flavor against those set on the node. Does not assume that resource class """ # Node resource class was added in API version 1.21. if not self._is_version_supported('1.21'): return f_id = self.instance['flavor']['id'] extra_specs = self.flavors_client.list_flavor_extra_specs(f_id) extra_specs = extra_specs['extra_specs'] # Pull the requested resource class and traits from the flavor. resource_class = None traits = [] for key, value in extra_specs.items(): if key.startswith('resources:CUSTOM_') and value == '1': _, _, resource_class = key.partition(':') if key.startswith('trait:') and value == 'required': _, _, trait = key.partition(':') traits.append(trait) # Validate requested resource class and traits against the node. if resource_class is not None: self.assertEqual(resource_class, self.node['resource_class']) # Node traits were added in API version 1.37. if self._is_version_supported('1.37'): for trait in traits: self.assertIn(trait, self.node['traits']) self.assertIn('traits', self.node['instance_info']) self.assertIn(trait, self.node['instance_info']['traits']) self.validate_scheduling()

commit_message:
Not able to set threshold value to ‘0’ in aodh alarm creation

Aodh alarm creation fails when threshold value is set to '0,
but it can updated to '0'.

Change-Id: Ia780e6cdbea97ffe82d6136ea740a221df30469c
Closes-Bug: #1743990

subject: Use update_provider_tree from resource tracker
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-11-16 00:10:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/58c4aad9db55600e6cbdbbcc7338f3baea3640ea', 'message': "WIP: Use update_inventory from the resource tracker

The resource tracker calls the new update_inventory virt driver method -
using it if available, and falling back to the existing
get_inventory-if-available business if it's not implemented - and
flushes the changes back to placement accordingly.

WIP: Currently just saving my place.  I think this is going to get split
into three changes:
- One to implement the new ReportClient.get_provider_tree method.  It
  will retrieve the provider tree associated with this compute node.  If
  it doesn't exist yet, it will create it with a (single, root) provider
  corresponding to the compute node.
- One to define the ComputeDriver.update_inventory method.  That method
  will be allowed to add descendants to the root provider (representing
  the compute node) and add/update inventory on said providers.
- Then this one, which uses the above.

By the way, we still need GET /allocation_candidates affordance for
nested resource providers before we can get serious about all of this.

Change-Id: I5ee11274816cd9e4f0669e9e52468a29262c9020
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

commit_message:
Use update_provider_tree from resource tracker

The resource tracker calls the new update_provider_tree virt driver
method - using it if available, falling back to the existing
get_inventory-if-available business if not - and flushes the changes
back to placement accordingly.

Change-Id: I5ee11274816cd9e4f0669e9e52468a29262c9020
blueprint: update-provider-tree
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/46/520246/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Retrieve the provider tree associated with this compute node. If # it doesn't exist yet, this will create it with a (single, root) # provider corresponding to the compute node. prov_tree = self.reportclient.get_provider_tree( compute_node.uuid, compute_node.hypervisor_hostname) # Let the virt driver rearrange the provider tree and set/update # the inventory throughout. updated = self.driver.update_inventory(nodename, prov_tree) if updated: # Now we have to walk the tree and normalize the inventory from # each provider therein - the driver-rearranged tree could # provide standard resources from providers other than the root for provider in prov_tree: _normalize_inventory_from_cn_obj(provider.inventory, compute_node) # And flush the changes back to the placement API self.scheduler_client.set_inventory_for_provider( provider.uuid, provider.name, provider.inventory) except NotImplementedError: # Okay, update_inventory isn't implemented yet - try get_inventory try: inv_data = self.driver.get_inventory(nodename) _normalize_inventory_from_cn_obj(inv_data, compute_node) self.scheduler_client.set_inventory_for_provider( compute_node.uuid, compute_node.hypervisor_hostname, inv_data, ) except NotImplementedError: # Eventually all virt drivers will return an inventory dict in # the format that the placement API expects and we'll be able # to remove this code branch self.scheduler_client.update_compute_node(compute_node)
deleted_lines: inv_data = self.driver.get_inventory(nodename) _normalize_inventory_from_cn_obj(inv_data, compute_node) self.scheduler_client.set_inventory_for_provider( compute_node.uuid, compute_node.hypervisor_hostname, inv_data, ) except NotImplementedError: # Eventually all virt drivers will return an inventory dict in the # format that the placement API expects and we'll be able to remove # this code branch self.scheduler_client.update_compute_node(compute_node)

commit_message:
Remove win32/nt checks for wrapper script gen

It now appears safe to remove the Windows conditions that skip
executing override_get_script_args() and install_wrapper_scripts().
Having demonstrated that bdist_wheel works, it should now work for
sdist too, and experiments do indeed appear to bear that out.

Change-Id: Ic243a3ccd3aee0dcb17d6419bc44271f5ebe5551
Closes-Bug: 1521407
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/24/502524/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for args in override_get_script_args(dist, executable, is_wininst):
deleted_lines: if sys.platform == 'win32': return develop.develop.install_wrapper_scripts(self, dist) if os.name != 'nt': get_script_args = override_get_script_args else: get_script_args = easy_install.get_script_args executable = '"%s"' % executable for args in get_script_args(dist, executable, is_wininst):

subject: Ensure that RDO/SUSE series repo instructions stay up to date
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-04-03 16:49:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/b5f61acbd1f30814c9c584097caf93526407db64', 'message': 'Ensure that RDO/SuSE series repo instructions stay up to date

The deployment host documentation gets out of date really quickly.

commit_message:
Ensure that RDO/SUSE series repo instructions stay up to date

The deployment host documentation gets out of date really quickly.
This patch makes it self maintaining. Note that due to the fact
that RDO/SUSE do not implement their repositories for a new
release until much, much later in the cycle, we use the previous
release repo for master. This will self-update during our RC
when the stable branch is cut.

Some formatting adjustments have made to prevent the interpretation
of URL's as links by sphinx and to remove the use of multi-line shell
commands.

Closes-Bug: #1759721
Change-Id: Id28540d335390a52e0eb65a734a1d594235265d6

commit_message:
Provide error codes for placement API

This blueprint describes a framework for providing additional
information in case of error when making requests of the placement API.
This information can be used on the client side to distinguish what
caused an error in the event of the same HTTP response code.

This is a re-proposal of a spec originally proposed to Queens. The main
changes are:

* It removes the requirement to implement the help link, suggesting
  we do that later.
* It adjusts the emphasis to being development of a framework rather
  than a complete overhaul of existing responses.
* Add links to:
    * a WIP of how to do it
    * placement api-ref
* Makes some comments in the Alternatives section about how we may
  wish to address microversions.

blueprint placement-api-error-handling
Co-Authored-By: Chris Dent <cdent@anticdent.org>
Change-Id: Id644f9f509ab382afe155cca0babf08a53d66338
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/93/418393/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================ Placement API error handling ============================ Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/placement-api-error-handling This blueprint aim is to provide, besides the HTTP response code, an information in JSON format for certain situations in consistent way, in the response body. Problem description =================== Currently, we can interact with specific elements like resource classes, inventories, allocation using placement REST API. If there would be an abnormal situation, where we have an inventory in use during the update. Placement API will respond with HTTP conflict code (409) if one of the other clients updated the same inventory, or there was detected generations mismatch. The only way to distinguish between those two situation is to analyze the messages, which are sent as a payload in the response, while relying on message text is flawed, like all messages which are put on the wire are translated so this alone can be a source of failure. Use Cases --------- As a consumer of placement API, I want to have a possibility for get more verbose reasons for failed requests, possibly with established return codes for different cases, so that I can react on each case accordingly. Proposed change =============== We propose to extend existing response with appropriate information returned in case of abnormal cases which will contain an well-defined structure, which can help consumers of the API to easily recognize type of the error cases. Format of the response payload will match API Working Group guide, as described in http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html. Alternatives ------------ We can keep things as it is, and examine returned messages from the API response for indicating what the cause was for certain error, although that approach have its own issues, like inability to use translated messages. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- Placement API calls, as described in blueprint `generic-resource-pools` are intact, with exception of returned response for `PUT`, `DELETE` and `POST` methods on unsuccessful cases. New microversion will be created. The API changes for the all endpoints within response for error situations. `POST /resource_providers` ++++++++++++++++++++++++++ The response in case of `409 Conflict` will become:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.create_failed", "status": 409, "title": "Resource couldn't be created", "detail": "Resource with the name `%(name)s' already exists.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#post-resource-providers" } ] } ] } `GET /resource_providers/{uuid}` ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ The response in case of `404 Not Found` will become:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.provider_not_found", "status": 404, "title": "Cannot find resource provider", "detail": "Resource provider with the uuid `%(uuid)s' cannot be found.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#get-resource-providers-uuid" } ] } ] } `PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}` ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ The response in case of `400 Bad Request` will become:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.invalid_request", "status": 400, "title": "Invalid syntax.", "detail": "Request have bad or invalid syntax.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#put-resource-providers-uuid" } ] } ] } The response in case of `404 Not Found` will become:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.provider_not_found", "status": 404, "title": "Cannot find resource provider", "detail": "Resource provider with the uuid `%(uuid)s' cannot be found.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#put-resource-providers-uuid" } ] } ] } The response in case of `409 Conflict` will become:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.already_exists", "status": 409, "title": "Resource already exists", "detail": "Resource with the name of `%(name)s' already exists.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#put-resource-providers-uuid" } ] } ] } `DELETE /resource_providers/{uuid}` +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ The response in case of `404 Not Found` will become:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.provider_not_found", "status": 404, "title": "Cannot find resource provider", "detail": "Resource provider with the uuid `%(uuid)s' cannot be found.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#delete-resource-providers-uuid" } ] } ] } The response in case of `409 Conflict` will become:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.resource_allocated", "status": 409, "title": "Resource allocated", "detail": "Resource `%(name)s' is allocated, so that it cannot be changed." "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#delete-resource-providers-uuid" } ] } ] } `GET /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories` ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ The response for `404 Not Found`:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.provider_not_found", "status": 404, "title": "Cannot find resource provider", "detail": "Resource provider with the uuid `%(uuid)s' cannot be found.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#get-resource-providers-uuid-inventories" } ] } ] } `POST /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories` +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ The response for `404 Not Found`:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.provider_not_found", "status": 404, "title": "Cannot find resource provider", "detail": "Resource provider with the uuid `%(uuid)s' cannot be found.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#post-resource-providers-uuid-inventories" } ] } ] } The response for `400 Bad Request`:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.invalid_request", "status": 400, "title": "Invalid syntax.", "detail": "Request have bad or invalid syntax.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#post-resource-providers-uuid-inventories" } ] } ] } The response for `409 Conflict`:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.inventory_exists", "status": 409, "title": "Inventory already exists", "detail": "Inventory for resource provider `%(name)s' already exists." "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#post-resource-providers-uuid-inventories" } ] } ] } `PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/inventories` ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ The response for `404 Not Found`:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.provider_not_found", "status": 404, "title": "Cannot find resource provider", "detail": "Resource provider with the uuid `%(uuid)s' cannot be found.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#put-resource-providers-uuid-inventories" } ] } ] } The response for `400 Bad Request`:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.invalid_request", "status": 400, "title": "Invalid syntax.", "detail": "Request have bad or invalid syntax.", "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#put-resource-providers-uuid-inventories" } ] } ] } The response for `409 Conflict` in case of generation conflict:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.generation_conflict", "status": 409, "title": "Generations conflict", "detail": "Resource provider generation conflict. Proposed capacity of total, reserved or allocation_ratio fields are in conflict with exists in allocations." "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#put-resource-providers-uuid-inventories" } ] } ] } The response for `409 Conflict` in case of race condition detected during setting inventory:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.inventory_not_found", "status": 409, "title": "Inventory gone", "detail": "Inventory record with resource class for resource provider %(name)s not found." "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#put-resource-providers-uuid-inventories" } ] } ] } The response for `409 Conflict` in case of inventory being updated by another process:: Content-Type: application/json { "errors": [ { "code": "compute.resource_providers.inventory_updating", "status": 409, "title": "Inventory currently being updated", "detail": "Inventory is being updating by another process." "links": [ { "rel": "help", "href": "http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/newton/implemented/generic-resource-pools.html?highlight=resource%20pools#put-resource-providers-uuid-inventories" } ] } ] } The response for commit_message:
Fix endpoint URI /allocation_requests

This patch updates the spec to get consistent with the implementation
changing the URI /allocation_requests to /allocation_candidates.

Change-Id: I3883607ffc1cb58b2d01a56e9655f54aa97f416d
Blueprint: placement-allocation-requests

commit_message:
Continue to work on adding an asterisk on the network address field of subnet create

The Network Address field in the Create Subnet workflow (Subnet tab) is missing an asterisk.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Go to Admin -> Networks
2. Click on a Network
3. Click Create Subnet
4. Attempt to create the subnet without filling in the Network Address field.

The error message is at the top of the form, when it should be by the field, and the Network Address field itself is missing an asterisk.

Closes Bug: #1420370

Change-Id: I8b34ad8ac7c140885a658c9a5aff5de5c3f35e9c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/09/491609/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I09095ca8bb36420f77cd2e372d7b478f28930fc8
Depends-On: I4c82a63baabd6b9304b302c97cd751a0103d8316
Closes-Bug: #1759098
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic refs/changes/50/558450/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*www_authenticate_uri*]# DEPRECATED PARAMETERS # # [*auth_uri*] # (Optional) Complete public Identity API endpoint. # Defaults to undef # $www_authenticate_uri = 'http://127.0.0.1:5000', # DEPRECATED PARAMETERS $auth_uri = undef, if $auth_uri { warning('The auth_uri parameter is deprecated. Please use www_authenticate_uri instead.') } $www_authenticate_uri_real = pick($auth_uri, $www_authenticate_uri) www_authenticate_uri => $www_authenticate_uri_real,

commit_message:
Services: Add support for K8S service's port edit use case

Kubernetes supports edit operation for API resources.
This patch extends service handler to support edit operation
of  K8S service's port field.

Change-Id: I286dd8a1383de8eda78637d455e6f8035f178c02
Closes-Bug: 1684096
(cherry picked from commit 677c38b2a6e6c18c251a7b20f2607283c7e831f1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/74/556874/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.base' '.PodSubnetsDriver.get_instance') @mock.patch('kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.base' '.PodProjectDriver.get_instance') @mock.patch('kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers.base' '.LBaaSDriver.get_instance') def test_sync_lbaas_members_svc_listener_port_edit( self, m_get_drv_lbaas, m_get_drv_project, m_get_drv_subnets): # REVISIT(ivc): test methods separately and verify ensure/release project_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() subnet_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() current_ip = '1.1.1.1' current_targets = { '1.1.1.101': (1001, 10001)} expected_ip = '1.1.1.1' expected_targets = { '1.1.1.101': (1201, 10001)} endpoints = self._generate_endpoints(expected_targets) state = self._generate_lbaas_state( current_ip, current_targets, project_id, subnet_id) spec = self._generate_lbaas_spec(expected_ip, expected_targets, project_id, subnet_id) m_drv_lbaas = mock.Mock(wraps=FakeLBaaSDriver()) m_drv_project = mock.Mock() m_drv_project.get_project.return_value = project_id m_drv_subnets = mock.Mock() m_drv_subnets.get_subnets.return_value = { subnet_id: mock.sentinel.subnet} m_get_drv_lbaas.return_value = m_drv_lbaas m_get_drv_project.return_value = m_drv_project m_get_drv_subnets.return_value = m_drv_subnets handler = h_lbaas.LoadBalancerHandler() with mock.patch.object(handler, '_get_pod_subnet') as m_get_pod_subnet: m_get_pod_subnet.return_value = subnet_id handler._sync_lbaas_members(endpoints, state, spec) self.assertEqual(expected_ip, str(state.loadbalancer.ip)) m_drv_lbaas.release_pool.assert_called_once()

commit_message:
Use neutron.default_quota_get to get default quotas for neutron

According to https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1204956,
Neutron provide the API to get default quotas.
This patch use this api for more readable code.

Change-Id: I6965ba88d53e04b16a0d5d21211244d4f4551918
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/30/373130/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if 'network' not in disabled_quotas: if tenant_mode: quotasets.append(_neutron_tenant_quota_get(request, tenant_id)) else: quotasets.append(neutron.default_quota_get(request, tenant_id)) return _get_quota_data(request, tenant_mode=True, disabled_quotas=disabled_quotas, tenant_id=tenant_id) def _neutron_tenant_quota_get(request, tenant_id, disabled_quotas): qs = base.QuotaSet()
deleted_lines: qs = _get_quota_data(request, tenant_mode=True, disabled_quotas=disabled_quotas, tenant_id=tenant_id) # TODO(jpichon): There is no API to get the default system quotas # in Neutron (cf. LP#1204956), so for now handle tenant quotas here. # This should be handled in _get_quota_data() eventually. if not disabled_quotas: return qs

commit_message:
fix lower constraints to match requirements

Today our requirements check build has been failing [1][2] because
what's specified in our lower-constraints.txt doesn't match what's
in our requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt.

This patch updates lower-constraints to match.
For additional details see the discussion started in [3].

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/38/553838/4/check/requirements-check/
74b56de/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-03_18_13_35_389665
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/38/553838/3/check/requirements-check/
b25a52f/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-03_15_02_38_526227
[3] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/
%23openstack-infra.2018-04-03.log.html#t2018-04-03T17:57:50

Change-Id: I8f0c9b1f5bb68731b1c96b432b34bbe5c86834bf

commit_message:
Show the project name in floating ip detail page

In the floating ip detail page, only display the "Project ID",
now display the "Project Name" make more sense.

Partial-Bug: #1626796
Change-Id: Id0fc9b0035550159c7ab0b8fc1213fc052dfdbef

commit_message:
Correction of chinese translation

"Availability Zone =" not translation in the dashboard view /dashboard/project/instances/ dropdown menu index 10.

In all other places "Availability Zone" translate into "KeYongYu",so correction it according.

Change-Id: I506e1bb7216e087bbe1f093c44ecb55b90e25fbd

commit_message:
Prefix the project description with RETIRED for retired projects

Prefix the project description with RETIRED for retired projects
and removed now obsolete groups, use-storyboard and docimpact
settings as well.

Change-Id: I3e2ed5c00ffa7764cd483eee9c0abec74a240e09

commit_message:
[Backup/Restore] Fix nits in docs and clarification note.

This fixes some nits in the docs.

This patch adds a note to show that
depending on the MySQL version used
the configuration file can be called
differently.

Change-Id: I1bfcf5566511284cf78422aada29f45b2628bf4b

added_lines: tar -xzC / -f undercloud-backup-$DATE.tar.gz etc/my.cnf.d/mariadb-server.cnf /root/undercloud-all-databases.sqlNote that depending on the MySQL version, the config file can be `/etc/my.cnf.d/mariadb-server.cnf` or `/etc/my.cnf.d/server.cnf`.

subject: Do not create NetworkVlanID is the value is not defined
revisions:

In case of Upgrade, the {{role}}NetworkVlanID is not defined
in network_data.yaml in Pike.
So when the jinja template generate the network_data.yaml
the parameter_defaults for the NetworkVlanID result to
empty parameters.
If no VlanID has been provided by user environment files,

commit_message:
Do not create NetworkVlanID is the value is not defined

In case of Upgrade, the {{role}}NetworkVlanID is not defined
in network_data.yaml in Pike.
So when the jinja template generate the network_data.yaml
the parameter_defaults for the NetworkVlanID result to
empty parameters.
If no VlanID has been provided by user environment files,
then we need to used the default defined in network/config/

Change-Id: If119f3900eb60a217b8209d59fb9bc900107addb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/72/554872/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: ignore location when comparing options for duplicate registration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-28 18:29:31.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_get_location.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config/commit/cb0f2bce87a270f430dcab32e55f61cda8321b6b', 'message': "ignore location when comparing options for duplicate registration

Before this change, two options that were identical except for the
location in the code where the Opt class was instantiated or how they
were initialized (the default, set_override, etc.) would compare as
not being equal. The result is that consumers of oslo.config that
include multiple definitions of the same option but in different files
would report an error for a duplicate option. The error may also be
triggered by using set_override() and re-registering an option under
some circumstances.

This patch ensures that the location where the option's value is set
does not factor into the equality check for the option.

Change-Id: I0c57f92c28f220009e01cfe641ec14039c51f671
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
ignore location when comparing options for duplicate registration

Before this change, two options that were identical except for the
location in the code where the Opt class was instantiated or how they
were initialized (the default, set_override, etc.) would compare as
not being equal. The result is that consumers of oslo.config that
include multiple definitions of the same option but in different files
would report an error for a duplicate option. The error may also be
triggered by using set_override() and re-registering an option under
some circumstances.

This patch ensures that the location where the option's value is set
does not factor into the equality check for the option.

Change-Id: I0c57f92c28f220009e01cfe641ec14039c51f671
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/67/557467/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _vars_for_cmp(self): # NOTE(dhellmann): Get the instance variables of this Opt and # then make a new dictionary so we can modify the contents # before returning it without removing any attributes of the # object. v = dict(vars(self)) # NOTE(dhellmann): Ignore the location where the option is # defined when comparing them. Ideally we could use this to # detect duplicate settings in code bases, but as long as the # options match otherwise they should be safe. if '_set_location' in v: del v['_set_location'] return v def __ne__(self, another): return self._vars_for_cmp() != another._vars_for_cmp() return self._vars_for_cmp() == another._vars_for_cmp()
deleted_lines: def __ne__(self, another): return vars(self) != vars(another) return vars(self) == vars(another)

commit_message:
Disable developer mode for tempest role tests

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/557720
- https://review.openstack.org/558524

Given that tempest is in upper-constraints and its releases
are published to pip, we don't need to use developer mode
for our tests. Also, given that we're not really in a position
to closely track every move the QA team makes, perhaps it
makes better sense for us to just used the released versions
for our tests so that we only have to deal with those changes
whenever they release, implying the confidence that they have
completed their implementation changes.

Change-Id: Ibc191f6fc33ca9a1807c01a23f476c4dfe225f33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/88/557988/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We prefer to use the released versions of tempest # for general role testing as it's more stable. tempest_developer_mode: False tempest_venv_download: False

commit_message:
Do not generate the html ARA report any more

In order to ensure a clean pick, this is a
combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/550956
- https://review.openstack.org/557921

With [1] we no longer need to generate the html report,
so in this patch we change the log collection process
in order to use the new mechanism.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128902.html

Change-Id: Ic05ac14ef8bc2f67c40f6d5356edbff32f5e6c5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/87/558587/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function find_files { find "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/" -type f \ ! -name "*.gz" \ ! -name '*.html' \ ! -name '*.subunit' \ ! -name 'ansible.sqlite' } function rename_files { find_files |\ while read filename; do \ mv ${filename} ${filename}.txt || echo "WARNING: Could not rename ${filename}"; \ done } function compress_files { # We use 'command' to ensure that we're not executing with an alias. GZIP_CMD="command gzip --force --best" find_files |\ while read filename; do \ ${GZIP_CMD} ${filename} || echo "WARNING: Could not gzip ${filename}"; \ done } # Store the ara sqlite database in the openstack-ci expected path store_artifacts "${TESTING_HOME}/.ara/ansible.sqlite" "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/ara-report/"rename_files # Generate the ARA subunit report so that the # results reflect in OpenStack-Health mkdir -vp "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/ara-data" echo "Generating ARA report subunit report." ${ARA_CMD} generate subunit "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/ara-data/testrepository.subunit" || truecompress_files
deleted_lines: # Get the ara sqlite database store_artifacts "${TESTING_HOME}/.ara/ansible.sqlite" "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/ara/"find "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/" -type f ! -name '*.html' -exec mv {} {}.txt \; # Generate the ARA report # In order to reduce the quantity of unnecessary log content # being kept in OpenStack-Infra we only generate the ARA report # when the test result is a failure. The ARA sqlite database is # still available for self generation if desired for successful # tests. mkdir -vp "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/ara" if [[ "${TEST_EXIT_CODE}" != "0" ]] && [[ "${TEST_EXIT_CODE}" != "true" ]]; then echo "Generating ARA report." ${ARA_CMD} generate html "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/ara" || true else echo "Not generating ARA report." fi # We still want the subunit report though, as that reflects # success/failure in OpenStack Health ${ARA_CMD} generate subunit "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/ara/testrepository.subunit" || true# We use 'command' to ensure that we're not executing with some sort of alias. command gzip --force --best --recursive "${WORKING_DIR}/logs/" || echo 'Note: gzip log files failed'

commit_message:
Add a documentation list default

This change adds the documentation list default to our systemd service
files when populated. This is feature will provide us the ability to
link services to specific documentation which operators will be able to
see when querying a service.

Change-Id: I514d907ccbb52cc6010a29c4c3e10eb2cf558dfa
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix some issues due to dnsmasq

As already suggested by TheJulia in the Debian family files, the installation
of dnsmasq package can lead to DNS issues which can prevent packages further
down the list to be properly installed

Change-Id: I81cd58c7c9cd4c22dbd3f08ba9a7dfea842e7d2d

commit_message:
Fix of masakari command for upcoming openstacksdk changes

In the next openstacksdk release, Profile is going away as
are entrypoints plugins. This patch modifies so that masakari
command can be used after that release.

Note: This code has been tested with a version other than
openstacksdk-0.10.0.

Change-Id: I162292cf6af2c4f716cbf1f2065488f0d30cdef6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-masakariclient refs/changes/79/547879/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix WF execution getting stuck on null description

Fix bug where creating wf execution with null description
marks workflow as RUNNING even if all tasks are complete.

Change-Id: If53012a41f6481c88fef44a43a1f17738d558f02
Closes-bug: #1711423

subject: Port scan driver for VNF application Monitoring
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-14 12:14:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/1def7e977aeba0d96fdaeb784abb6449cfd8b9ed', 'message': 'portscan driver for VNF application Monitoring

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-15 11:40:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/ca5111fce6c53716356305cce033c616de32b234', 'message': 'portscan driver for VNF application Monitoring

This driver is Port monitoring driver for checking application
Status.

Until now, Tacker monitoring drivers can check network(ping) and
application(using HTTP URL).

Moreover, When VNF is rebooted by Ping monitoring result, tacker
re-make same whole VNF.

Therefore, I think port monitoring driver is needed for auto
healing of VNFC level and it is a useful when we check the
VNF inside status too.

Change-Id: I13a2e2ff90c8f30f2468f266c8ab39b948a86772
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-01 07:58:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker/commit/1c08817e1a89faacb9fee8b1fe01032163f640d0', 'message': 'portscan driver for VNF application Monitoring

re-make same whole VNF.

Therefore, I think port monitoring driver is needed for auto
healing of VNFC level and it is a useful when we check the
VNF inside status too.

Change-Id: I13a2e2ff90c8f30f2468f266c8ab39b948a86772

This driver is Port monitoring driver for checking application
Status.

Until now, Tacker monitoring drivers can check network(ping) and
application(using HTTP URL).

Moreover, When VNF is rebooted by Ping monitoring result, tacker

Therefore, I think port monitoring driver is needed for auto

commit_message:
Port scan driver for VNF application Monitoring

This driver is Port monitoring drivers for checking application
Status.

Until now, Tacker monitoring drivers can check network(ping) and
application(using HTTP URL).

Moreover, when VNF is rebooted by ping monitoring result, tacker
recreates all of the same VNFs.

In this situation, port monitoring driver helps for auto
healing of VNFC level and it is a useful when tacker check the
VNF inside status too.

Change-Id: I13a2e2ff90c8f30f2468f266c8ab39b948a86772
Implements: blueprint portscan-monitoring

added_lines: # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # from oslo_config import cfg from tacker.agent.linux import utils as linux_utils from tacker.common import log from tacker.i18n import _LW from tacker.openstack.common import log as logging from tacker.vm.monitor_drivers import abstract_driver from socket import * LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('count', default='3', help=_('number of checking port to decide port error.')), cfg.StrOpt('timeout', default='1', help=_('number of seconds to wait for a response')), cfg.StrOpt('sockmode', default='1', help=_('socket mode of TCP, UDP(TCP:1, UDP:0)')), cfg.StrOpt('scanports', default='22', help=_('number of Target port')) ] cfg.CONF.register_opts(OPTS, 'monitor_port') class VNFMonitorPort(abstract_driver.VNFMonitorAbstractDriver): def get_type(self): return 'port' def get_name(self): return 'port' def get_description(self): return 'Tacker VNFMonitor Port Driver' def monitor_url(self, plugin, context, device): LOG.debug(_('monitor_url %s'), device) return device.get('monitor_url', '') def _is_portable(self, mgmt_ip="", count=3, timeout=1, sockmode=1, scanports=22, **kwargs): """Checks whether an port is used by application. Using portscanning , it can check application port which is used by application. Use socket library , it can check port of target VM. :param mgmt_ip: Target VM management IP address :param count: number of port error. :param timeout: number of seconds to wait for a response :param sockmode:socket mode of TCP, UDP(TCP:1, UDP:0) :param scanports: number of Target port :return: bool - True or string 'failure' depending on portability. """ try: while count > 0: if sockmode: connskt = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM) else: connskt = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM) connskt.settimeout(timeout) result = connskt.connect_ex((mgmt_ip,scanports)) if result == 0: LOG.debug(_("OPEN ip address: %s, port: %d\n"), mgmt_ip, scanports) connskt.close() break else: LOG.debug(_("Close ip address: %s, port: %d\n"), mgmt_ip, scanports) connskt.close() count = count -1: if count == 0: return 'failure' else: return True except RuntimeError: return 'failure' @log.log def monitor_call(self, device, kwargs): if not kwargs['mgmt_ip']: return return self._is_portable(**kwargs)
